name: Psychocat: The Answer
description: "Short" Arcade Game about the life of a cat named "Zag", who desperately seeks an answer. The evil and unique gameplay is about reversing the controls on the keyboard.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Xp / Vista / 7 Processor: Intel® Pentium® 4 2.0 GHz equivalent or faster processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVidia GeForce 8600/9600GT, ATI/AMD Radeon HD2600/3600 Storage: 200 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Decently fun and reasonably challenging, but the fact you can't leave until you finish the game is way too annoying.
i can play the game for about 10 min before i get a headache and it wont let me leve the game normally. still a good game though
Probably the hardest one handed game i'll ever get to play. One of those dimes coming out of nowhere. Get it if you're much into pure challenge.
addictive and frustrating.  what else can you wish for?
it says in the game tags its 'casual' HOW THE .♥♥♥♥ING .♥♥♥♥ IS THIS A CASUAL GAME! 10/10 its actually my favorite game of all time.
best spent 99c everrr. 11/10 my eyes are bleeding

'Psychocat: The Answer' is a difficult and challenging game that is great for people who like a challenge. It has an interesting core mechanic in which coloured walls that invert your controls come, and there is no way to dodge them. I feel this adds a lot of challenge to the game and I find it quite fun!  All in all I think it's a great game for those who love a challenge.
